page.title: 02GENERAL INTRODUCTION PART 2
page.content: { The River Lea}used to provide a means of transporting grain to London but is now mainly used for recreation. It forms pt. ofthe Lea Valley Regional Park which provides a whole range of recreational activities for the area. { Hoddesdon}is an old market town and was at one time a coaching station. There are a variety of light industries upon which the local area is very dependent. To the east of the river, farming and nurseries have given way to sand and gravel quarries which cover a large part of the eastern area of the grid. The nurseries still make a useful contribution to the economy of the area. The urban population has increased considerably during recent years mainly because of industrial growth. Many new housing estates now exist.
